channel.title: redmine on Oh The Huge Manatee!
channel.description: Recent content in redmine on Oh The Huge Manatee!

item.title: Another cryptic Ruby message
Running Redmine in a subdirectory
item.description: {% raw %} Redmine is a fantastic project management tool for technically oriented organizations.  At my job, we use it to manage 30-50 active projects at a time, as well as the back history of several hundred projects.  Oddly enough, the normal installation process puts it on port 3000 .  We had some trouble with developers' ISPs not allowing HTTPS traffic over non-standard ports, so we had to move redmine onto port 443 along with the rest of the SSL traffic.
